reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Contribution to universal access of DRC population to effective and impactful interventions against malaria

description.narrative: Congo (Democratic Republic) - Malaria - Ministry of Health of the Democratic Republic of Congo - MOH. This program has the following goals: Contribuer à l'élimination du paludisme en République Démocratique du Congo et, de ce fait, améliorer l'état de santé de la population générale par la réduction de la charge humaine et socio-économique due au paludisme / Contribute to the elimination of malaria in the Democratic Republic of Congo and, therefore, improve the state of health of the general population by reducing the human and socio-economic burden due to malaria. The objectives of this program are: Réduire de 40% la morbidité liée au paludisme par rapport aux données 2018 / Reduce malaria-related morbidity by 40% compared to 2018 data.. Réduire de 50% la mortalité liée au paludisme par rapport aux données 2018 / Reduce malaria mortality by 50% compared to 2018 data.

title.narrative: Impact indicator for COD-M-MOH
Malaria test positivity rate
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
All-cause under-5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Coverage / Output indicator for COD-M-MOH
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of facilities that receive supportive supervision – at least once per quarter
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at private sector sites
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at private sector sites
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Percentage of health facilities providing diagnostic services with tracer items available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
M&E-other 1: Number and % of staff (Hospitals and Health Centers) that have been supervised on a quarterly basis
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Outcome indicator for COD-M-MOH
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Malaria O-Other 1: Proportion of pregnant women having received IPTp according to national guidelines
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
